result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dameon L Hunt

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Dameon L Hunt
Current: 2218 Luann Ln Apt 107, Madison, WI 53703 United States  (Effective: 10-26-2022)
Prior: 2218 Luann Ln Apt 107, Madison, WI 53713

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Shavone W. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 3300 block of Leopold Way in Fitchburg.
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 14
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

3:08 PM Defendant Dameon L Hunt in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathleen Chung in court for Dameon L Hunt.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
